post.heading: Patent Case Over. Blog Reawakens.
post.p: Early last year, I learned of a comprehensive new Hangprinter patent. I decided to go after it, as it made community members nervous.
I got lots of help. I found an awesome lawyer and we presented prior art to the USPTO. The broad claims were then rejected.
In order to save some straws of their patent, the holders narrowed their claims. They were pushed to cover just a narrow design path, on top of the publicly available Hangprinter base design.
Fortunately, they chose to own an inferior, uninspiring path that should be avoided anyways, for technical reasons. Trivial workarounds exist otherwise.
So we have won, in the sense that we can forget about the whole thing.
